alert.note: Alert for Flat Tops (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:16PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Garfield and east central Rio Blanco Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles north of Glenwood Springs, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Garfield and east central Rio Blanco Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
